intro.headline:
Agricultural Subsidies:
New Countries, Same Problems
intro.abstract: The Common Agricultural Policy of the European Union gives out a lot of money to farmers - 60 billion each year. While it does help some farms, most of this money incentivizes farmers to grow cash crops and employ less workers.

outro.content:
Farm subsidies in Bulgaria, Romania and other EU countries have pushed farmers out of labour-intensive farming, such as vegetables, towards cash crops.

Farming cash crops creates unemployment and environmental damage (erosion).

In 1999, the Commission said it would tackle the problem. Instead, it made it worse.

labels.Germany (until 1990 former territory of: Germany (until 1990 former territory of the FRG)
